source.name: World Health Organization (2011)
source.additionalInfo: Because smallpox was eradicated in 1977, there were no new cases since 2010 so we extended the time series until 2016.

66553.name: Estimated number of paralytic polio cases (WHO, 2018 and Tebbens et al., 2011)
66553.datasetName: Reported number and different estimations of polio cases (WHO, 2018)

source.name: WHO (2018) and Tebbens et al. (2011)
source.dataPublishedBy: Our World in Data based on World Health Organization (2018) and Tebbens et al. (2010)
source.dataPublisherSource: WHO collects data through own surveillance system
source.additionalInfo:
For the estimated number of polio cases using Tebbens et al.’s 2010 model:
The WHO’s dataset of reported polio cases from 1980 onwards (the first link above) is used to produce an estimate of the actual number of polio cases. An explanation of the correction factor algorithm can be found here: https://ourworldindata.org/tebbens-et-al-2011-estimation-of-the-number-of-paralytic-polio-cases/ Part of the model input consists of the WHO’s surveillance system that can be found under the second link cited above. 


For the estimated number of polio cases that disregard any reported cases after a country was certified polio-free and use Tebbens et al.’s (2010) model: 
The WHO’s dataset from 1980 onwards (the first link above) was modified by deleting all documented polio cases after the year in which polio ceased to be endemic in each country (see map and data here: https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/the-decade-of-the-last-recorded-case-of-paralytic-polio-by-country). Then, Tebbens et al.’s  (2010) model is applied in the same way as for the “Estimated number of polio cases”, for which we provide an explanation here: https://ourworldindata.org/tebbens-et-al-2011-estimation-of-the-number-of-paralytic-polio-cases/.

source.name: World Health Organisation (2018)
source.dataPublisherSource: National government reporting to the WHO
source.additionalInfo: We excluded all countries that the WHO labelled as "guinea worm not endemic in the 1980s" from this dataset as these countries never documented any cases of guinea worm disease.

85935.name: Number of reported yaws cases (WHO 2018)
85935.datasetName: Global number of yaws cases - WHO Global Health Observatory (2018)

source.name: WHO Global Health Observatory (2018)
source.dataPublishedBy: World Health Organization's Global Health Observatory
source.additionalInfo: Yaws has received very little attention from the international community so the global number of reported cases relies on summing of the cases reported by only 13 countries.
